1322 26 Lk 157 66 80 Tues June 25 2 Kgs 199b 11 14 21 31 35a 36 Ps 482 4 10 11 Mt 76 12 14 Wed June 26 2 Kgs 228 13 231 3 Ps 11933 37 40 Mt 715 20 Thurs June 27St Cyril of Alexandria Bishop and Doctor of the Church 2 Kgs 248 17 Ps 791b 5 8 9 Mt 721 29 Fri June 28St Irenaeus Bishop and Matryr 2 Kgs 251 12 Ps 1371 6 Mt 81 4 Sat June 29 SS Peter and Paul Apos tles Acts 121 11 Ps 342 9 2 Tm 46 8 17 18 Mt 1613 19 Sun June 30 Thirteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time Wis 113 15 223 24 Ps 302 4 6 11 13 2 Cor 87 9 13 15 Mk 521 43 or 521 24 35b 43 Twelfth Sunday in Ordinary Time June 23 2024 This weekend June 22nd 23rd the Church throughout the world celebrates the Twelfth Sunday in Ordinary Time In addition to this celebration for the universal Church our parish Church also has an additional celebration today the fifty eighth anniversary of the dedication of our church building Liturgically this celebration is considered a solemnity meaning that our parish is able to celebrate it even in the midst of Ordinary Time Fifty eight years ago on June 26 1966 Fr Bob Traub our eighth resident pastor was joined by Bishop Leo Pursley the sixth bishop of our diocese to dedicate our new church building By all accounts it was a sweltering Sunday as the temperature rose to a high of 93F Yet the blazing heat didn't keep parishioners from attending as the newly built church was said to be overflowing by the time that the Mass of dedication started Though we will still hear the readings for the Twelfth Sunday in Ordinary Time today the prayers of the Mass will come from the Common of the Dedication of a Church on the Anniversary of the Dedication In these prayers we give thanks to God for this very building a visible sign of the Church herself It is in this visible house that God let us build that He wonderfully manifests and accomplishes the mystery of His communion with us Every year around this time I often reflect on the words that Fr Traub shared in preparation for the building of the new church in the 1960s This building will serve as a testimony to our story the vibrant epic of the way in which the life of God is nourished in our souls It begins with the first blessing sought by the expectant mother for her newly conceived child and ends only with the last benediction begged by grieving families for their departed loved ones During all the years in between filled with work and rest joy and sorrow pleasure and pain the Altar is the center of our attention Our freely offered sacrifices at this time will be recognition of the value we place upon our supernatural life and our desire for it to grow stronger in St Joseph Parish And every year these words strike me as even more true and beautiful As our parish family continues to grow I think of how our church building itself serves as a place of encounter with Jesus Christ in a real and unique way Greeted in Baptism strengthened in Holy Communion and Confirmation forgiven in Confession and wept over in death The steps between the nave and the sanctuary bridge the gap between heaven and earth It is here that we go up the mountain of the Lord and here where the Lord comes to His people Though it is the fifty eighth anniversary of this church building our parish is nearing its 150th anniversary Officially established as a parish in 1875 this coming year of 2025 will mark our sesquicentennial celebration It is my hope that this coming year will be one not only filled with great celebrations to mark this wondrous anniversary but as a chance to renew our commitment to serving our neighbors right here in our local community Parish Council Nominations Please return any remaining nominations for the Parish Council either to the Parish Office or in the collection basket by next weekend Once nominations are closed those nominated will be contacted in July to ensure that they are willing to accept the nomination before two new names are drawn to join our Parish Council Nomination sheets are available in the Narthex Helping Hands Baby Bottles If you haven't yet done so please return any remaining Baby Bottles to the Parish Office These Baby Bottles collected from Mother's Day through Father's Day will help to support local Helping Hands Pregnancy and Family Resource Center Thank you for your overwhelming generosity to this local ministry for our community Faithfully in Christ Fr David In honor of our anniversary this weekend's bulletin cover is a retro cover being one of our main bulletin covers used in the 1980s PARISH CALENDAR Sat June 22 Confession 4 4:45pm Mass 5:00pm Sun June 23 Mass 2024 by Fr David Violi Life Adventures Home School Co Op will be hosting the Kona Ice Truck this Thursday June 27th from 100 2:30PM in the parish parking lot as part of a summer fundraiser All are welcome to stop by and enjoy some Kona Ice very Special Thank you To Our Missionary Team Maria Luke Lexie and Eric for spending the week with us We learned about the Apostles Creed prayed the Glorious Mysteries and attended daily Mass Thank you to all our Volunteers who helped with snackwater breaks lunch and our annual Totus Tuus Parish Potluck we could not have done it without you May we continue to keep the Missionaries in our prayers as they travel to St Joseph Parish in South Bend next week Knights of Columbus Father Aloysius Phillips Council 7555 Saint Joseph was a just man a tireless
